labels.analysis: The MCP Server integrates Tavily's advanced search and extraction tools, enabling real-time web search and intelligent data extraction. It allows for sophisticated filtering and domain-specific capabilities, making it highly useful for gathering up-to-date web information, content analysis, and research tasks. The tools provided—tavily-search and tavily-extract—focus on web searches and extracting processed data from URLs, enhancing workflows for AI assistants.
labels.reasoning: The primary functionality aligns closely with web search and research capabilities, as the tools enable querying the web and extracting structured data. The secondary label of Content Creation is relevant due to the server's role in gathering and processing content, which can support writing, analysis, or media generation. No custom label is required, as predefined categories adequately capture the server's purpose.

server_info_crawled.overview: Enable real-time web search and intelligent data extraction within your AI assistant by integrating Tavily's advanced search and extraction tools. Seamlessly access up-to-date web information with sophisticated filtering and domain-specific capabilities. Enhance your AI workflows with powerful web search and content extraction features.

tools.description: Deploy Server Tavily MCP Server @StevenFengLi/tavily-mcp Try in Playground tavily-search

tools.name: tavily-extract
tools.description: A powerful web content extraction tool that retrieves and processes raw content from specified URLs, ideal for data collection, content analysis, and research tasks.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@StevenFengLi/tavily-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())

smithery_configuration_requirements.name: tavilyApiKey
smithery_configuration_requirements.description: The API key for the Tavily MCP server.
